children.name: cry
children.definition: if you cry, tears come from your eyes, for example because you are sad or upset, or because you have hurt yourself:
examples: khóc
▪ I could hear the baby crying in the next room.
Tôi có thể nghe được tiếng em bé khóc ở phòng kế bên
▪ Kim’s eyes were red and she looked as though she’d been crying.
Đôi mắt của Kim đỏ và trông cô ấy như đang khóc
▪ Don’t cry, I didn’t mean to upset you.
Đừng khóc, tôi không cố ý làm bạn buồn
cry about
khóc vì
▪ Jenny won’t tell me what she’s crying about.
Jenny sẽ không nói tôi biết cô ấy khóc vì cái gì
make somebody cry
làm ai đó khóc
▪ The film was so sad, it made me cry.
Bộ phim quá là buồn, nó làm tôi khóc
cry and crycry for a long time
khóc cả ngày
▪ I sat alone in my room and cried and cried.
Tôi đã ngồi một mình trong phòng và khóc cả ngày
cry your eyes outcry a lot because you are very upset
khóc muốn mù mắt
▪ The poor kid’s so miserable, he’s upstairs crying his eyes out.
Đứa trẻ nghèo thật là bất hạnh, thằng bé đang khóc muốn mù mắt ở trên gác
cry with happiness/joy/relief etc
▪ She cried with joy when she heard that the children were safe.
cry yourself to sleepcry until you fall asleep
▪ At night I’d cry myself to sleep, thinking about you.
cry[singular noun]
▪ You’ll feel better when you’ve had a good cry.

children.name: weep
children.definition: [especially written] to cry quietly and for along time because you are very sad or you feel a strong emotion: nhỏ lệ, nhỏ nước mắt
examples: ▪ She sat beside her dying father and wept.
Cô ấy ngồi bên cạnh người cha đang hấp hối và rơi nước mắt
weepopenlywithout trying to stop or hide it
òa khóc
▪ Thousands of French citizens, many weeping openly, bade a silent farewell to Mitterand.
Hàng ngày người dân pháp, rất nhiều người đã òa khóc, nói lời chào tạm biệt thầm lặng tới Mitterand
weep with emotion/grief/joy etc
khóc vì thương tiếc/vui sướng
▪ I remember weeping with pride when my first son was born.
Tôi còn nhớ tôi đã khóc vì tự hào khi con trai đầu lòng ra đời
weep bitterlycry strongly
khóc thảm thiết
▪ His mother wept bitterly and his father sat grim-faced.
Mẹ anh ấy khóc thảm thiết và cha ngồi nhăn mặt

children.name: sob
children.definition: if you sob, you crynoisilyand your bodyshakes, because you are very sad or because someone has upset you:

children.name: khóc nức nở
examples: ▪ The sound of her sobbing kept them awake all night.

children.name: Tiếng nức nở của cô ấy khiến họ thức cả đêm
examples: ▪ ‘Please don’t leave me,’ he sobbed.

children.name: 'Đừng rời bỏ tôi,' anh ấy nức nở
examples: ▪ The child covered her face with her hands and started to sob uncontrollably.

children.name: Đứa trẻ lấy tay che mặt và bắt đầu nức nở
be in tears
children.definition: crying because someone has upset you, or because something is very sad:

children.name: trong nước mắt , đang khóc
examples: ▪ Everyone started to laugh and Frank ran out of the room in tears.

children.name: Mọi người bắt đầu cười nhạo và Frank chạy ra khỏi phòng trong nước mắt
examples: ▪ Most of us were in tears by the time he’d finished his story.

children.name: Hầu hết chúng tôi đã khóc khi ông ấy kết thúc câu truyện
bawl
children.definition: to cry loudly - use this especially about young children or people you do not have any sympathy for:
examples: ăn vạ
▪ ‘Stop, bawling,’ Dad said crossly, ‘and come over here.’
' Đừng ăn vạ.' Người cha gắt gỏng, ' qua đây.'
▪ The baby was sitting in his high chair, red in the face and bawling.
Đứa trẻ ngồi trên cái ghế cao, đỏ mặt ăn vạ

children.name: snivel/sniffle
children.definition: to cry in a weak, complaining way and at the same time breathe in air noisily through your nose:
examples: sụt sịt, sụt sùi, tủi thân
▪ "What are you snivelling about, Jake?'
'Tại sao bạn lại sụt sịt thế Jake ?'
▪ She kept sniffling into her handkerchief and saying how unfair everything was.
Cô ấy cứ sụt sịt vào chiếc khăn tay và than vãn mọi thứ khộng công bằng như thế nào

children.name: whimper
children.definition: to make a quiet, continuous, unhappy sound like an animal in pain, or to say something with this sound in your voice:
examples: thút thít
▪ ‘I’m sorry,’ she whimpered, but Richard wasn’t listening.
' Em xin lỗi,' cô ấy thút thít, nhưng Richard không nghe
whimper with
khóc thút thít vì
▪ Pat whimpered with the pain of the bullet wound in his shoulder.
Pat khóc thút thít vì vết thương do đạn trên vai mình
whimper[countable noun]
tiếng khóc thút thít
▪ The boy’s crying died down to a whimper.
thằng bé khóc thầm chết lặng

children.name: tears
children.definition: drops of water that come from your eyes when you are crying - this is often used to represent the idea of crying:

children.name: ▪ Grandpa wiped the tears from his eyes.have tears in your eyes/with tears in your eyes be nearly crying▪ Yusuf had tears in his eyes, and I knew he was thinking of home.▪ She turned to me with tears in her eyes and begged me to help her.tears roll/run down somebody’s cheeks someone cries a lot▪ He stood silently, tears rolling down his cheeks, while the music played.▪ Mum showed us the letter with tears running down her cheeks.be close to tears almost crying
examples: ▪ Howell was close to tears as he told the court what had happened.

children.name: make sb cry
children.definition: make somebody cry

children.name: khiến ai đó khóc
examples: ▪ David often teases his little sister and makes her cry.

children.name: David hay trêu đứa em gái và làm nó khóc
examples: ▪ She was so unhappy that the slightest thing made her cry.

children.name: Cô ấy thật không hạnh phúc khi thứ yếu ớt nhất cũng làm cô ấy khóc
reduce sb to tears
children.definition: reduce somebody to tears  to make someone cry bybehavingunkindlyor by making themfeelsad:

children.name: làm ai khóc
examples: ▪ He shouted at Louise and in the end reduced her to tears.

children.name: Anh ta quát mắng Lousie và cuối cùng đã làm cô ấy khóc
examples: ▪ Sam was almost reduced to tears by the sight of his mother in a hospital bed.

children.name: Sam hầu như khóc khi nhìn thấy mẹ mình trên giường bệnh
bring tears to sb’s eyes
children.definition: bring tears to somebody’s eyes/bring a lump to somebody’s throat   to make someone start to cry, or nearly start to cry:

children.name: làm ai đó suýt khóc
examples: ▪ Just the thought of saying goodbye to Craig brought tears to her eyes.

children.name: Chỉ với ý nghĩ phải chia tay với Craig cũng làm cô ấy suýt khóc
examples: .▪ This movie is guaranteed to bring a lump to your throat.

children.name: Bộ phim này đảm bảo sẽ làm bạn suýt khóc
bắt đầu khóc
examples: ▪ Jim turned away from me and started to cry.

children.name: Jiim quay đi tránh mặt tôi và bắt đầu òa khóc
examples: ▪ ‘I want Daddy to come home,’ Anna said, starting to cry.

children.name: ' Con muốn Cha trở về nhà,' Anna nói và bắt đầu khóc
examples: ▪ Just at that moment, the baby started crying.

children.name: Chỉ trong một khoảng khắc, em bé bắt đầu khóc
burst into tears
children.definition: tosuddenlystart to cry because you are upset about something:

children.name: khóc òa
examples: ▪ Laura burst into tears and ran out of the room.

children.name: Laura òa khóc và chạy ra khỏi phòng
break down
children.definition: tosuddenlystart to cry a lot, after trying not to cry:
examples: vỡ òa , khóc òa
▪ I broke down when he’d gone, knowing that I might never see him again.
Tôi vỡ òa khi anh ta đi và hiểu rằng tôi có thể không bao giờ nhìn thấy anh nữa
break down and cry
Vỡ òa và khóc
▪ As the funeral service began, Frances broke down and cried.
Khi nghi thức tang lễ bắt đầu, France vỡ òa và khóc
break down in tears
vỡ òa trong nước mắt
▪ All the worry and anxiety had been too much for her, and she suddenly broke down in tears
Mọi sự lo lắng và nghi ngờ là quá nhiều với cô ấy, và đột nhiên cô vỡ òa trong nước mắt.

children.name: turn on the waterworks
children.definition: British informal to deliberately start to cry in order to get someone’s sympathy or persuade them to do something:

children.name: khóc lấy lòng
examples: ▪ She was one of those people who could turn on the waterworks in order to get what they want.

children.name: Cô ta là một trong những đứa có thể khóc lấy lòng người khác để đạt những thứ mà nó muốn
stop crying
examples: ngừng khóc
▪ The little girl, who was very thin with a pale face, couldn’t stop crying.
Cô bé nhỏ xíu, người gầy nhom với khuôn mặt nhợt khạt, không thể ngừng khóc
▪ ‘Now stop crying,’ Marilla said, ‘and tell me what’s the matter.’
' Giờ thì ngừng khóc đi,' Manilla nói, ' Nói cho tôi biết chuyện gì đã xảy ra.'

children.name: dry your eyes
children.definition: /tears especiallywrittento stop crying, especially because someone has done or said something to make you feel happier:

children.name: lau nước mắt
examples: ▪ Harry didn’t mean to upset you. Now dry your eyes and come back downstairs.

children.name: Harry không cố ý làm bạn buồn. Giờ thì lau nước mắt và xuống lầu nào
examples: ▪ At the thought of an ice-cream, Zoe dried her tears and began to smile.

children.name: Chỉ với cây kem, Zoe đã lau nước mắt và bắt đầu cười
don’t cry
children.definition: say this when someone is crying, especially when you want to comfort them:

children.name: đừng khóc mà
examples: ▪ Please don’t cry! You’ll make me want to cry as well.

children.name: ' Làm ơn đừng khóc mà! Em làm anh muốn khóc theo luôn
examples: ▪ It’s alright, he won’t hurt you -- don’t cry.

children.name: Tất cả đã ổn, ông ấy sẽ không làm em đau đầu -- đừng khóc
wipe your tears
children.definition: wipe the tears from your eyes/  to stop crying and use your hand or something else to dry your face - used especially in literature:
examples: lau nước mắt, gạt nước mắt
▪ ‘Do you really mean that?’ Jane said, wiping the tears from her eyes
'Bạn thật sự có ý như thế ầ?' Jane nói rồi lau nước mắt trên mặt
.▪ ‘Wipe your tears, dear,’ Mrs Bristow said. ‘It’s not as bad as all that.’
'Lau nước mắt đi cưng,' Bà Bristow nói ' Mọi thứ không tệ như vậy đâu.'

children.name: be close to tears
children.definition: /be on the verge of tears

children.name: suýt khóc
examples: ▪ The lesson was going very badly and the student was close to tears.

children.name: Buổi học rất tệ và các học sinh đã suýt khóc
examples: ▪ Fiona was on the verge of tears as the train pulled out of the station.

children.name: Fiona đã suýt khóc khi xe lửa ra khỏi ga
have a lump in your throat
children.definition: to have a tight feeling in your throat and feel that you might start crying
examples: nghẹn ngào
: ▪ I had a lump in my throat watching Rick go up to get his prize.
Tôi nghẹn ngào nhìn Rick đi lên nhận giải
bring a lump to somebody’s throat
khiến ai đó nghẹn ngòa
▪ The sight of the soft green hills of her homeland brought a lump to her throat.
Khung cảnh đối núi xanh ngắt ở quê hương khiến cô ấy nghẹn ngào

children.name: fight back tears
children.definition: to try very hard not to cry even though you are almost crying:

children.name: kìm nước mắt
examples: ▪ Bill fought back his tears and tried to comfort Sarah’s mother.

children.name: Bill kìm nước mắt và cố gắng làm hài lòng mẹ Sarah
examples: ▪ I quickly left the room, fighting back tears of rage and frustration.

children.name: Tôi nhanh chóng rời khỏi phòng, kìm nước mắt giận dữ và thất vọng
